Sl00mIDuJdAqEoDRAp-twQ.text: Naaaaaaasty, FILTHY & Ruuuuuuddde!!!!!!I'm staying down the street from this place and saw all the kind reviews...This place was absolutely filthy there is a wait station near the front that was covered in splattered sauce and noodles - yuuuuck!!! The place is open to the street and they are working on the sewer, yes the sewer!! I walked to the back and thought I would order, I asked about the menu and just received a retort from a sweaty man, "NO MENU!!". The people working in the kitchen looked similarly sweaty and dirty. The kitchen stunk. What a filth hole! Singapoeans have a great deal of pride in the cleanliness of their country; the health authorities are definitely letting one slip here!!!

jzKbsujBWsOOmAakDXf74g.text: Long queues, crispy prata, long wait, quite stuffy and not a convenient location. Would revisit on a cooler less crowded day if I stayed nearby.

l9xfTwoWbG3ZsURWn10clw.text: I would not say I am a big fan of roti prata. I probably eat it less than 5 times a year. But I love the prata here!Crispy and not oily. Served to you freshly fried. I like my prata to have a good doughy bite plus a crispy outer skin and this one is totally it. You can request for fish curry to go with your prata too which is a little more tangy than meaty curry.On weekends, the wait can be quite long. Thank god I don't live near here or I can imagine putting on the pounds. A totally cheap and yummy breakfast for less than $1 for a kosong prata.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Crispy prata!

GgGUl5u8C0MsTnJ4R9dlfQ.text: Simple, cheap and good, it's a great prata experience for breakfast or lunch. It's in a little coffees hop on Crane Road so it's all pretty no frills, but if you eat in the prata is fresh, which is all you need!

tnO4ysNZdcV1uJqqzkKfHw.text: Although a relative newbie in the hawker scene, Mr & Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata have been consistently ranked as one of the top roti prata vendors in Singapore. Manned by the gentle, soft-spoken couple whose eponymous stall is distinguished by its unabating lines, you're happy to wait in a stuffy, old-school coffeeshop that's as dank as it is rank. Because you're ultimately rewarded for your sweaty efforts with a heaping plate of the best prata I've had in a very long time. I'm partial to Egg Prata ($1.40), and these were beautifully crispy, torched with a golden hue, while fluffy and chewy inside. What's most surprising, however, was how little ghee and oil was used; there was hardly a trace of oil left on the plate when I was done.The default curry accompanying pratas is the Dhal Cha, a thick, beany yellow lentil-based curry that the chilli-averse will likely take to. Should you prefer a more meaty or spicier curry, there's the fish or the mutton.

aQwpZwpVBIs9L_8AIzYQGQ.text: Nestled in a corner of a traditional open air restaurant space, shared with three other hawkers is the purveyor of the best crispy roti prata. Mr M is making each one to order. Mrs M playing up. The queues are long but together they churn out the goods. A favorite breakfast place for me on Sunday's. Not easy to get there from Marina Bay but I make the effort. I recommend that you do too!

-lwtcmHNSpKc_UcOOP3sgQ.text: Absolutely delicious roti prata!  The trek to get there was a bit far for me, however it was worth it. I got the plain, egg, and mushroom and cheese. It comes with curry on the side to dip the roti prata. My favorite was the plain, others were good as well but it doesn't beat the flakiness and crispiness of the plain.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore

ZexsSWKQ3Rl82Y_2EmNNNA.text: Be ready to have to wait a bit here.  It is a local favorite, in the suburbs of SG.  Most fresh rotis are pretty good too, but this place shines above and beyond (in a diminishing returns sort-of-way) by having slightly better dough, better hand/grease/slap/rotate action, and the crispiness of their roti. The gravy served with is also pretty good.  I would definitely come by again if I was nearby, otherwise your local roti place is probably not too far away.  Though this still is the best roti I've had, i'm not sure if its worth the wait and distance from the city.

EuaKD8blPmDYd8LpVVTkBg.text: Came by the other day for breakfast and it was an odd experience. Placed an order with the Mrs. And she told me to sit down in the ventilated but still hot and humid dining room. After a good 10-15 minutes in the sweltering heat, went back up to the Mrs. And she quickly brought out my Roti Pratha...Weird.The roti was light and flaky. The curry sauce was okay, nothing to write home about. For $1 it was definitely a local experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Roti Pratha - $1 SGD
Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Iced Tea with Milk - $1.3 SGD

Xh844F8wn0kA6Bwxa4xs3g.text: Really cheap and probably worth 5 stars except the wait was extremely long (didn't time it but it was between 30min-hour). As other reviews stated, it's not greasy. Just delicious. At approx $1d, it's great value. Note they were serving many different types of rotis. They all looked the same to me on the menu, so I'm not sure how to differentiate when ordering.

AVEtmMQOUgjpnFUz8SerqA.text: Good roti prata!! Wait, and your order is taken, and they write it on a paper and grab a seat. That's about it. Pretty simple. You pay when you get the order. They make it all fresh and so you'll get a hot prata that isn't super greasy like some places.

e3frA3uQwr0zM8dyC6LvWQ.text: This place has become a hit or miss lately. Not sure what the problem is but the prata either come out overcooked, too soft and oily or not at all what we ordered. Plus I think they up charge you if they think you are a foreigner. I don't think I'll be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Plain crispy prata

-mJmPQZro7bV_SShYT-nKw.text: The best!!!The safest food and natural homemade ready crispy fried so good top it off with curry sauce heaven in the morning

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. I love the food was absolutely good and the cheapest

8OI12sP2LGjisTM3ILoKmw.text: Can't believe I forgot to review this place four months ago. And so I waited, biding my time until I could next fly out and enjoy the best prata I've ever eaten in my life. I booked my accommodation so I could be close to this stall, not even kidding. It's a tiny setup located within a restaurant on Crane Street. Open in the mornings until early afternoon it's a mum and pop stall that makes only prata. A local spot in a quiet part of town. My favourite is the plain prata. I've had it with egg and onion which was good, and also with cheese which I'm pretty sure was Kraft cheese slices. Served alongside curry sauce for dipping, it's a sheer delight. Three prata and coffee with milk (ordered separately through the restaurant) this me back $4.00. My favourite local cheap eat in Singapore and the best prata ever. It's crispy and moreish but not greasy and dense. An absolute must if you're visiting the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore

tg8OkHEm_6boRcgyq_sk1g.text: The fish curry sauce is very good but the prata is not so - crispy on the outside but not fluffy inside and I need to extract unexpanded dough out.

UON-yTlAwV9JqfZq7RC08w.text: Who doesn't love Roti Prata! Especially one as crispy and mouthwatering as Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Prata. Amazingly, not oily at all! Lines can be long depending on what time of day you go, especially with some patrons making some large orders. This is definitely the Prata gem of the Joo Chiat area.Personally, I would stick with the plain Prata to get a real sense of how good the Prata skin really is. I found that the egg and onion Prata I ordered diluted the crispyness/taste of the skin.4-stars for the worldly Prata, but dock one star because of the limited selection. I'm a sucker for egg and banana Prata, which was not available at this stall. :D

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. 2 x egg and onion Prata
Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Prata making at its finest!

YJL6SMYodK4UmSNjJAAcxw.text: Yes, YES, YAAAAAAAAAAS!I love me some prata, and this one's the prata to beat all pratas.This stall has a very humble setting in a bustling coffee shop off Joo Chiat Road. If you walk up and happen to be 2nd or 3rd in the queue, don't be surprised if there are 5+ people ahead of you who put in big orders and are waiting on the side!Menu is pretty straightforward; I ordered their plain prata and tried the onion and egg one. If you're having it there, the order guy will write down your order on the clip board and simply say "Okay, I'll call you."Grab a table, order some teh or kopi, and wait. If you can, remember who was in front of you so you have an idea when your order comes up. Don't be surprised if it's been 15 minutes. If the guy wrote down your order, it will come! Also, it'd be good to REMEMBER your order so if he asks for a refresher, you can easily let him know.My wait was fruitful. I got crispy, not-too-greasy prata that filled me up through mid-afternoon, and of course the sauces that came with it were boss.This is the real deal and I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Egg and onion prata
Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. 2 plain, 1 onion Prata, $2.50

13hx1RUEkE6RMVOyumKRtg.text: Once or if we're lucky, twice every year we get to fly to the Food Paradise that is Singapore. This is one of our "go to" food centres when we're in Singapore because of it's proximity to our lodging with family.Usually the tell-tale sign of a good dish or chef is the lines out the front but I think some people just enjoy lining up for food at times in Singapore without their being any substance behind the food for my tastes but Mr and Mrs Moghan's Super Crispy Prata is well worth the wait.Prata is basically an unleavened bread that is expertly flipped near on like a pizza is and moulded until it has many thin layers of pastry, like a croissant. Prata is usually crispy and flaky on the outside, whilst remaining doughy on the inside. It makes a great breakfast, brunch or lunch but I can eat it any time of day and it is so incredibly more-ish. The Prata is always super crispy as promised in their name and the curry is always nice to dip the prata in, as is tradition. Although you can wait a little to find a seat, it's well worth it or you can always take away or Ta Pao in the local Singlish (Singapore/English) lingo.I'd also recommend that people look inside for seats too when seeking a seat as although it's a little warmer in the humidity of Singapore, quite often it's easier to sneak a seat and don't park illegally as you will most likely get a ticket.The little refreshments store serves up Iced Horlicks too which I can't help but get one every time we head there. I love the malty, milky goodness to kick off the day.Like anywhere in Singapore that serves at breakfast, I'd recommend getting there early as often places sell out.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Roti Prata..
Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Street View..
Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Roti Prata..

EcGnXIMnbGGeua0Q_nd0oA.text: Probably one of the best Prata in Singapore. Really love the crispy prata especially their egg prata.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. This is probably one of the best Prata in Singapore. Not too oily yet crispy.

JJpPvUVk2jstCWb68cPT5g.text: It is a great local restaurant that provides many choices of food. Many residents come with their family for feeding themselves. It is just near to the hotel where I stay for a night. If you want to get some cheaper food for your fresh morning, it is a nice place to eat casually.

810bHPumD3BuD93lqn1Wew.text: Had excellent prata here. The mushroom cheese prata I ordered came piping hot and oozing with cheese. Definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Oozing cheese

R4yQNz4XWYp9UHMOriYGow.text: Plenty of seating outside away from the smoky griddle.  Parking is quite limited.The roti pratas were crispy on the outside and very stretchy on the inside.  The thick and chunky curry included was a daal curry with a surprising bit of mutton flap meat.  It looks like there was a upgrade option for the curry to full mutton chunks but i missed it on the menu.Roti prata was $1.00 each for plain. $0.50 for egg, $0.80 for mushrooms and $0.30 for onion. Kopi and other drinks, as well as nasi lemak, offered by vendor sharing same space.

wOiQTfJFdyQY4JpCdouHtw.text: First time here! We enjoyed a selection of four pratas: egg, cheese, onion and mushroom. Taste - very good (and crispy as advertised) ... lite and not oilyQuality - actually much better we think than the prata on KillineyPresentation - are you kidding? If you're local, it's really the taste and quality that count. But presentation is authentic and on a stainless steel plate with three condiments/curries tooService - the Mrs. is very polite (the Mr. and associate rotated in their prata prep and cooking)Ambience - open air on the corner with inside (within the building and sidewalk) and outside (on the sidewalk) seatingCost: Couldn't go wrong for ~ S$6 for two with the healthy-size prata servings.  We also had two hot coffees too at S$1 each from a next door vendor.  Think cost and value are the key factors after taste and quality. Definitely a repeat-go-back-to-dining destination. And, yes, there can be folks waiting for their orders (even at 8 in the morning) but I observed the Mrs. does maintain a good awareness on each of the individuals/families whose order is whose as she writes them down on her hanging clip board. Popular with locals from all backgrounds.  A definite recommendation.  And compliments to the Mr. and Mrs. and the support folks too. We can appreciate the place's popularity.

f-tdNaSMimvprvYqHBS_9A.text: Laaaiiiiiiiiiiiii liaaaaaooooooooo!!!Gotta love the drink store brothers... Classic hokkien rhymes at its best (:Good honest couple churning out roti prata with passion. Seriously one of the best in my opinion. Do make a trip down , give it a go, no regrets .

5iikWhgSr_A_x0extEF_mw.text: The name of this place is very true to the experience. There was Mrs Mohgan taking order and handing out the dishes and Mr Mohgan making the fresh prata's to order.  No frills and all good food.  Go early to get a comfy plastic seat.  A hidden gem so I'm a little reluctant to write about this but it's too good not to tell others.  I tried 1 cheese and 1 onion Prata with a side of fish curry.  Many others had kofe with their breakfast too.  Off the beaten path but worth a visit if you want some good local fare. Made another local foodie friend so all in all it was a great random stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Onion roti
Photo of Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata - Singapore, Singapore. Cheese roti with fish curry

s_Pd3T98XBCypMdutf0dBg.text: Excellent prata. Crispy but not oily. Had 3 kosong bawang pratas with mutton and fish curry. Will try cheese, mushroom and egg pratas next time.
